title: Lux has a huge gameplay issue and Riot has been refusing to aknowledge it for months
body:
https://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/client-new-features-feedback/OecZcuvK-with-the-new-ap-items-luxs-e-needs-to-change-asap


I made a PBE thread as soon as i tested the AP changes when they came out. I am Mastery 7 on Lux and as many others do probably it wasn't such a big thing to predict she'd become **TRASH** tier with the changes :

https://puu.sh/zxR1m/ad5560f4db.png


I called it, lots called it and despite that Riot just denied it. When it comes to skins she gets the sweet spots but gameplay wise she has had the biggest inconcistency for years and now it hurts her like never before. 

Her laning phase is bad. Her E costs 130 mana so more than her goddamn ultimate and it cannot even kill CASTER MINIONS. In fact Lux was and is the only mage in the game who strictly needs to use minion dematerializer in order to wave clear, which is insane. But that she cannot do anymore because her E cost is garbage and without Morello she has insane mana issues. Couple that with the fact that..you know..she can't waveclear and you get the miserable winrate she currently has and will have until they buff her. She can only burst something once in hope it doesn't have shields or anti-cc and then hide in a bush in shame until her atrocious CD are back.


Can we finally have a real Rioters thoughts on Lux's state and WHY they allow her E for all this time to be this bad in both cost and efficiency? THANK YOU.


*Always remember this [meme](https://i.imgur.com/XDG413Al.png)*

Her E costs a lot because it is oppressive lane harass. You can only avoid it by standing really far back and accept being zoned off the minions because it's only dodgeable when it has the full travel time. So it can't cost less mana.

Here's a reasonable option but I doubt they'll do it:

Rescale the mana cost to 60/70/80/90/100
Rescale the base damage to 50 / 100 / 150 / 200 / 250
Make it more delayed. Maybe a 0.25s delay when it pops, or maybe adjust the travel time so that it starts out slower and speeds up so that mid-range it can be dodged.

Lux mains will downvote this post but I'm just telling the hard truth. A harass tool that good can't be cheap. It has to be a worse harass tool if you want it to be cheaper.

I understand the statement but there are a lots of cases like this where they don't have as much early issues as Lux. Azir first comes in mind then Xerath then obviously the biggest : Brand. You can't look at Brand and tell me he isn't as oppresive as Lux (especially in bot lane sadly) wtihout the clear and mana issues.


Also this isn't really about skillshots. Ok she has range but at some point you can get poked by anyone and anything in lane. You can get poked by Orianna easily, E'd by Syndra too. Lux has no mobility so she can still be punished to some degree. This is more about scaling and early laning which drastically changed with AP itemization. Where other mages can still poke and farm comfortably, Lux struggles to even clear caster minions while running out of mana in barely 3/4 E cast. You have the choice to either poke or farm TERRIBLY and that shouldn't be the case. In late game she struggles to find a place in teamfights where she has too much cooldowns and low utility. It's why her winrate is so low and her early so bad.

> Can we finally have a real Rioters thoughts on Lux's state and WHY they allow her E for all this time to be this bad in both cost and efficiency?

As to her current state, general opinion is that she's not great from a power perspective, and I'd believe it if she didn't win big off the AP item changes.

Lux's E has been allowed to have its cost:damage ratio be so poor because the spell is pretty unfair from a hittability perspective. We could probably make it a bit smaller or slower but more efficient, but we'd want to make sure it didn't leave it unsatisfying or negatively impact her pattern.

Avoid making it slower or smaller. Instead make it so that it requires charge-up like Gragas' Barrel Roll in order to do maximum damage. This would make her quick pokes less damaging, but give her the waveclear she desperately needs and gives her more teamfight potential if she coordinates with her team's CC.

The idea of it charging up is attractive, but it comes at the cost of requiring changes to visualization and audio which adds a LOT of time to how fast we could get something in the game, especially for a champion with as many skins as Lux.

If really needed too, her E could be smaller then gradually increase in size to also show the increase in power, that wouldn't require **too much tweaking** right? (would also fix the annoying poking issue)

It's a direction we could look into. There's also a bit of a question as to whether we're supposed to be increasing waveclear for champions like Lux, or reducing waveclear for champions on the top of the waveclear charts to be closer to her. The better gameplay could be the latter.

It's meant to be a metric of balance for, well, all champions, really.

The frustrating thing, though, is that people talk an awful lot about mobility creep, CC creep, damage creep, etc.

But no one talks about waveclear creep. Which is a big problem. 

Graves' rework gave him amazing waveclear. Quinn's rework gave her waveclear. Caitlyn's rework buffed her waveclear. Tristana's rework buffed her waveclear. Xayah has insane waveclear. Jhin has good waveclear. Statikk Shiv had its waveclear substantially buffed over the years. And that's just ADCs. Titanic Hydra has given an entire class of champions with bad waveclear significant access to it. Galio's rework gave him amazing waveclear. Poppy's rework gave her dramatically increased waveclear.

I could keep going at this for a loooong time. That's not to say that every instance of this has been a bad design choice. A lot of those changes were great at the time, or still are great. But there's at least a few bad apples in every bunch.

I understand your hesitancy to buff Lux's waveclear, but I think it's completely justified in the case of Lux. Because Lux, quite frankly, has a number of issues with her identity, and it's one of the few things you can safely buff without a rework  that shifts her identity. I think she'll have problems until she gets something between a minor rework and a full scale rework. But she's nowhere near troubled enough to deserve that sort of attention anytime soon. Which is kind of sad.

Her W, Q, and E slow zone all seem to suggest she's more of a utility mage like Orianna, Morgana, Zyra, or Zilean, but her R, damage, and harass encourage her to play more like Vel'koz, Xerath, or Ziggs.

I'm not saying she needs to perfectly fit into one box, but as it stands she's stuck with some of the weakest parts of two different types of mages.

I disagree (regarding waveclear creep).

Waveclear creep isn't so much a thing as easily destroyed towers has forced strong waveclear to be a necessity.

Azir is P/B in pro play because he excels at defending a tower alone (he can take on multiple people and come out alive). Part of this is fast, consistent waveclear. Him scaling well is pretty much the icing on the cake.

At this stage, if you pick a team with low waveclear, there's little you can do to stop a 5 man from walking down mid and taking first two towers.

I think buffing Lux is the lower hanging fruit here. You could try to reduce waveclear and/or mana sustain of waveclear in general but I think it would mean nerfing a lot of champions which currently don't need nerfs (balance is relative) because you'd be lowering the bar for what is allowed.

The problem with that is some champions would struggle without their waveclear if it's the only thing they do which is reliable.

What about adding a splash mechanic on her passive that only activates if she autos a champion? Lux's main problem is she can't pump damage in a teamfight, even compared to her fellow "pick mages". Zoe's q is on a much lower cool down, Ahri Q too, Syndra still has respectable dps once she has unloaded her burst. It's not feasible to auto 1 by 1 all enemies with her low attack speed. Even PowerOfEvil evidenced this and ran for some time a build including nashor's tooth so he could actually do something in between the huge cooldowns. Getting in auto range past laning phase is REALLY risky, she should get rewarded more for it, and be allowed to have a drawback option if she's unable to 100-0 their squishies. Also if this was allowed even on monsters/bigger minions she wouldn't just be able to afk clear every wave but she could answer to the push many champions do on her during cannon minion wave, being able to clear specifically those waves. It wouldn't even require new animations, just a sort of hitbox for the effect (not sure on the shape and dimension.. Ideally it would be wide enough to clear cannon waves but not enough to hit properly positioned enemy champions. I don't want her to hit the backline through their frontline but damage said frontline more if she commits to auto them). I understand she's not supposed to be that strong vs tanks but all her competition does it better then her, even at their still low effectiveness.. When the enemy team has 2+ pure tanks you are currently better off buying ardent censor and hope the actual damage dealers on your team make use of the team wide buffs at the time being , unless the enemy fucks up their positioning really badly and allow you access to their backline

Edit: Also please don't add a charge up mechanic to her E. Lux is already too unreliable vs her competition making her MORE unreliable will not help her, I see somewhere 2 seconds charge up as a suggestion... Do you really think someone is going to stand 2 seconds into Lux E? This would incredibly gut her, unless  the initial damage was the current one, the cd was cut in half and the mana cost lowered incredibly. But then she would have numbers problems xD

We could probably make it a bit smaller or slower but more efficient, but we'd want to make sure it didn't leave it unsatisfying or negatively impact her pattern.

Out of idle curiousity, and because the idea just occurred, have you considered splitting the damage of Lux's E into an activatable effect (or instant burst) and a delayed burst? Something like that might enable you to add more counterplay with, say, a partial damage + slow that bursts harder if it cooks on the ground. Advantages here would be an increase in the vision utility over just the burst and an increase in Lux's potential zoning power, as well as a power boost to her E+Q reward, while making the E itself less potent as a harass tool without counterplay.

Might be interesting to explore as an option that might let you bake more powerful/satisfaction into the rest of her kit, and avoid the frustration that might occur from a smaller radius on her set-up tool.

Another interesting bonus -- it would potentially give another passive proc to Lux players with good timing.

Hello, as a fellow Lux player - I do enjoy her but I would not call myself a main since I only have ~118k mastery on her - I do not think her E is unfair to her.  Yes, it can't 1shot casters until you get some AP behind you, but it does allow her to easily auto the casters with her passive, which is almost the same thing.  I personally think it is much better as it was intended - a poke/zoning tool.  She is designed to move into mid-range to optimize her passive, which I rarely see people doing consistently with her.

It is not "almost" the same thing.

Getting into 550 range to autoattack the minions easily puts you under enemy pressure. They can harass you while you can't really retaliate. Against assassins, it can mean death. Try walking into Akali's R range post 6 to last hit minions, or Zed's ult/W range, or Kassadin's R range, or Fizz's vicinity post 6. Having an efficient waveclear tool lets you avoid interacting with these champions and stay safe, which you should be doing as Lux. 

It means you will almost never have lane priority, because the enemy can kill caster minions, or in some cases like Taliyah, the entire wave with one rotation while you struggle to one shot caster minions with your E. 

It's also frustrating when your ADC/jungler/whatever comes mid and takes away all your caster minions from you, simply because of more AD + more AS + better AA animation.

Would making lux E do more damage if its left to sit longer potentially help, akin to gragas Q?

If a charged E was effective waveclear but an uncharged one not so much (i.e. doing less than live), it might make more interesting choices between waveclear or harass, instead of the current situation where it's none or both depending on tuning.

(CD and/or mana cost could also be more freely tuned alongside the above.)
That would be far better than the current state indeed, and a good answer to the poke/farm issue.
